patterns.pattern: Shifting your weight to the balls of your feet, you begin to feel capable of quicker movements.
Your body is too tired to strengthen itself again so soon.
Your muscles are too tired to become nimble again so soon.
The constant exertion has worn you down, and you cease your nimble manuveurs, panting.
You allow your muscles to relax once more as you cease to bolster them.
Your muscles have recovered enough for you to be nimble once more.
Your muscles have recovered enough for you to bolster them once more.
